column2: Move from unlimited to limited liability (e.g. sole trader to Ltd/CLS)
Company ceases to exist on death of owner in sole trader or partnership, but not in Ltd/CLS
Access to capital (e.g. partnership can have 2–20 investors, but Ltd/CLS can have up to 149 investors)
Ltd/CLS pays 12.5% tax on profits, whereas sole traders pay the same rates as a PAYE employee (20–40%)
More owners bring more skills/experience/expertise; changing the structure allows this
